ordinarily, we'd work solely with bytes32, we need to truncate nodeValues up the tree.  Therefore, we need to declare certain variables with lower byte-lengths: LEAF_HASHLENGTH = 32 bytes; NODE_HASHLENGTH = 27 bytes; 5 byte difference * 8 bits per byte = 40 bit shift to truncate hashlengths. 27 bytes * 2 inputs to sha() = 54 byte input to sha(). 54 = 0x36. If in future you want to change the truncation values, search for '27', '40' and '0x36'."}}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/Users/samuelstokes/repos/baseline/examples/bri-2/node_modules/@baseline-protocol/contracts/contracts/privacy/Shield.sol":"Shield"},"evmVersion":"istanbul","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/Users/samuelstokes/repos/baseline/examples/bri-2/node_modules/@baseline-protocol/contracts/contracts/privacy/IShield.sol":{"keccak256":"0xc7bca3cd7a9dd0ced80acb4b5508c641263792242bf3e86c45b92bbd71f1e96d","license":"CC0","urls":["bzz-raw://72986738dbacf98910d517745f2c68aa3aaba068e5a5e673038586b89efd3fee","dweb:/ipfs/QmZKQJJacbPwhpd7VzNkWZwtpdS4MCLG3fupjSMLpJ3MRV"]},"/Users/samuelstokes/repos/baseline/examples/bri-2/node_modules/@baseline-protocol/contracts/contracts/privacy/IVerifier.sol":{"keccak256":"0x68c264488382eba50784a14f3618137fe08a977b0ecaeb165cfd4a22bce0a210","license":"CC0","urls":["bzz-raw://dd44e433910e21f8256d855ef403ddfe581b6a1320635a237cf07b0ada9e18f5","dweb:/ipfs/Qmdx7BANa8dhaim36RbqDLh4FTcob2LzJUuo3VbDaHqV6r"]},"/Users/samuelstokes/repos/baseline/examples/bri-2/node_modules/@baseline-protocol/contracts/contracts/privacy/Shield.sol":{"keccak256":"0x987e75f0871481eba624bdf7781520d0164ef31f7b94484728e0e3db13e39ed7","license":"CC0","urls":["bzz-raw://06d8603c8fd97110e40aefdb3fe7dd3df98c6df006e799afc8fa2458ab62bc7a","dweb:/ipfs/QmdJAM62mNk5Eb56RUdSPttGqD9yZwYRQtfsqHvdnsapvw"]},"/Users/samuelstokes/repos/baseline/examples/bri-2/node_modules/@baseline-protocol/contracts/contracts/privacy/lib/MerkleTreeSHA256.sol":{"keccak256":"0xb09e6edc1b59f355a284be2de116ea61b9a59d632f8a03a9411e1db031f4bed4","license":"CC0","urls":["bzz-raw://a25a6acc5c80867c0fd91111b547e7c824d9ce41d2ee51ae050dc9d27bf0fb1b","dweb:/ipfs/QmUjxv8swj5D1ZqjsB893ZYNjJtZBK9QABv2GFUKswSHdy"]}},"version":1}

zero().notice: Whilst ordinarily, we'd work solely with bytes32, we need to truncate nodeValues up the tree.  Therefore, we need to declare certain variables with lower byte-lengths: LEAF_HASHLENGTH = 32 bytes; NODE_HASHLENGTH = 27 bytes; 5 byte difference * 8 bits per byte = 40 bit shift to truncate hashlengths. 27 bytes * 2 inputs to sha() = 54 byte input to sha(). 54 = 0x36. If in future you want to change the truncation values, search for '27', '40' and '0x36'.
